channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MS
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MS

item.title: Report X-2023120729
item.description:
Report X-2023120729

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-05T18:16:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-12
  • City: OLIVE BRANCH
  • State: MS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was brought to QA in a drum, leaking out. The package was immediately placed in a yellow hazmat drum to prevent further spillage. DescribePack: Cap was cracked, caused leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package and affected areas were immediately cleaned up.

item.title: Report X-2023120811
item.description:
Report X-2023120811

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-05T18:16:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-06
  • City: OLIVE BRANCH
  • State: MS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was brought to me by members of Hub personnel in an outer container. The damaged package was immediately placed in a yellow hazmat drum. DescribePack: Package was improperly unloaded and punctured on the bottom; there is a small hole on the right corner of the package with the contents spilling out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package and spill were cleaned up.
